title: Social Constructivist-Based Instructional Design for Collaborative Language Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate or higher language proficiency and basic digital literacy
context.additional_context: An environment enabling real-time interaction and data collection using personal devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: Learners can proactively lead verbal interactions with peers at a frequency of over 80% during collaborative task performance
Learners can apply feedback routines based on sociocultural constructivist theory to correct or suggest peer language errors with 70% accuracy
Learners can analyze their interaction patterns on a weekly basis using learning analytics tools and develop improvement plans

resources: Collaborative Learning Platform Accounts (Padlet, Slack, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
